newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Tallinna Pank again active on Estonian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Tallinna Pank again active on Estonian bourse.

text.p: Shares in Tallinna Pank again topped the most active list on the Estonian stock exchange on Tuesday, turning over 8.7 million kroons and closing slightly lower at 38.75 kroons versus 38.89.
Overall market turnover on the main list was 13 million kroons and the index rose 0.43 percent to 97.19.

Savings Bank was little affected by news Hansapank, Estonia's largest bank, and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) did not plan to buy any of the new shares Savings Bank plans to issue. It traded a small 830,000 kroons and eased to 34.70 from 34.85 kroons.
On the free market, volume came to 4.4 million kroons and shares in plastics maker Norma were the most traded on 3.2 million kroons.
Hansapank trader Tonu Pekk said there were some rumours that Norma may release a profit statement but nothing came of them.
Norma closed at 21.80 kroons, versus 21.55 on Monday.
